newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka closes weaker against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka closes weaker against dollar.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed weaker at 42.5465/5480 to the dollar in a dull interbank session, against a previous close of 42.5460/5475, dealers said.
The local unit quoted at 42.5470/5490 per dollar in early trade. "Demand (of dollars) was slightly higher than on Tuesday but supply was again adequate," said one dealer.

There was increased activity in the interbank call money market as some state-owned banks came to borrow. The call money was traded at 7.0 percent to 7.75 percent, up from Tuesday's 6.0 percent to 6.75 percent.
